defs.docs: Graphics state blocks for gfx-rs

defs.name: state
defs.docs: Fixed-function hardware state.

defs.name: Clockwise
defs.docs: Clockwise winding order.

defs.name: CounterClockwise
defs.docs: Counter-clockwise winding order.

defs.name: FrontFace
defs.docs: The front face winding order of a set of vertices.

defs.name: LineWidth
defs.docs: Width of a line.

defs.name: Offset
defs.docs: How to offset vertices in screen space, if at all.

defs.name: CullFace
defs.docs: Which face, if any, to cull.

defs.name: Point
defs.docs: Rasterize as a point.

defs.name: Line
defs.docs: Rasterize as a line with the given width.

defs.name: Fill
defs.docs: Rasterize as a face with a given cull face mode.

defs.name: RasterMethod
defs.docs: How to rasterize a primitive.

defs.name: Primitive
defs.docs:
Primitive rasterization state. Note that GL allows different raster
 method to be used for front and back, while this abstraction does not.

defs.name: front_face
defs.docs: Which vertex winding is considered to be the front face for culling.

defs.name: method
defs.docs: How to rasterize this primitive.

defs.name: offset
defs.docs: Any polygon offset to apply.

defs.name: get_cull_face
defs.docs: Get the cull face, if any, for this primitive state.

defs.name: MultiSample
defs.docs: Multi-sampling rasterization mode

defs.name: Never
defs.docs: `false`

defs.name: Less
defs.docs: `x < y`

defs.name: Greater
defs.docs: `x > y`

defs.name: Always
defs.docs: `true`

defs.name: Comparison
defs.value: Comparison::{Never, Less, LessEqual, Equal, GreaterEqual, Greater, NotEqual, Always}
defs.docs: A pixel-wise comparison function.

defs.name: Keep
defs.docs: Keep the current value in the stencil buffer (no change).

defs.name: Zero
defs.docs: Set the value in the stencil buffer to zero.

defs.name: Replace
defs.docs: Set the stencil buffer value to `value` from `StencilSide`

defs.name: IncrementClamp
defs.docs: Increment the stencil buffer value, clamping to its maximum value.

defs.name: IncrementWrap
defs.docs: Increment the stencil buffer value, wrapping around to 0 on overflow.

defs.name: DecrementClamp
defs.docs: Decrement the stencil buffer value, clamping to its minimum value.

defs.name: DecrementWrap
defs.docs: Decrement the stencil buffer value, wrapping around to the maximum value on overflow.

defs.name: Invert
defs.docs: Bitwise invert the current value in the stencil buffer.

defs.name: StencilOp
defs.value: StencilOp::{Keep, Zero, Replace, IncrementClamp, IncrementWrap, DecrementClamp, DecrementWrap, Invert}
defs.docs: Stencil mask operation.

defs.name: StencilSide
defs.value: StencilSide { fun, value, mask_read, mask_write, op_fail, op_depth_fail, op_pass }
defs.docs: Complete stencil state for a given side of a face.

defs.name: fun
defs.docs: Comparison function to use to determine if the stencil test passes.

defs.name: value
defs.docs: Reference value to compare the value in the stencil buffer with.

defs.name: mask_read
defs.docs:
A mask that is ANDd with both the stencil buffer value and the reference value when they
 are read before doing the stencil test.

defs.name: mask_write
defs.docs: A mask that is ANDd with the stencil value before writing to the stencil buffer.

defs.name: op_fail
defs.docs: What operation to do if the stencil test fails.

defs.name: op_depth_fail
defs.docs: What operation to do if the stenil test passes but the depth test fails.

defs.name: op_pass
defs.docs: What operation to do if both the depth and stencil test pass.

defs.name: Stencil
defs.docs: Complete stencil state, specifying how to handle the front and back side of a face.

defs.name: Depth
defs.docs: Depth test state.

defs.name: fun
defs.docs: Comparison function to use.

defs.name: write
defs.docs: Specify whether to write to the depth buffer or not.

defs.name: Add
defs.docs:
Adds source and destination.
 Source and destination are multiplied by blending parameters before addition.

defs.name: Sub
defs.docs:
Subtracts destination from source.
 Source and destination are multiplied by blending parameters before subtraction.

defs.name: RevSub
defs.docs:
Subtracts source from destination.
 Source and destination are multiplied by blending parameters before subtraction.

defs.name: Min
defs.docs:
Component-wise minimum value of source and destination.
 Blending parameters are ignored.

defs.name: Max
defs.docs:
Component-wise maximum value of source and destination.
 Blending parameters are ignored.

defs.name: BlendValue
defs.value: BlendValue::{SourceColor, SourceAlpha, DestColor, DestAlpha, ConstColor, ConstAlpha}

defs.name: target
defs.docs: Render target specification.

defs.name: Layer
defs.docs: A depth value, specifying which plane to select out of a 3D texture.

defs.name: Level
defs.docs: Mipmap level to select in a texture.

defs.name: Depth
defs.docs: A single depth value from a depth buffer.

defs.name: Stencil
defs.docs: A single value from a stencil stencstencil buffer.

defs.name: Rect
defs.docs: A screen space rectangle

defs.name: ColorValue
defs.docs: A color with floating-point components.

defs.name: Mask
defs.docs: Output mask, used for blitting and clearing

defs.name: Mirror
defs.docs: Mirroring flags, used for blitting

defs.name: ClearData
defs.docs: How to clear a frame.

defs.name: color
defs.docs: The color to clear the frame with

defs.name: depth
defs.docs: The depth value to clear the frame with

defs.name: stencil
defs.docs: The stencil value to clear the frame with

defs.name: DrawState
defs.value: DrawState { primitive, multi_sample, scissor, stencil, depth, blend, color_mask }
defs.docs: An assembly of states that affect regular draw calls

defs.name: primitive
defs.docs: How to rasterize geometric primitives.

defs.name: multi_sample
defs.docs: Multi-sampling mode

defs.name: scissor
defs.docs:
Scissor mask to use. If set, no pixel outside of this rectangle (in screen space) will be
 written to as a result of rendering.

defs.name: stencil
defs.docs: Stencil test to use. If None, no stencil testing is done.

defs.name: depth
defs.docs: Depth test to use. If None, no depth testing is done.

defs.name: blend
defs.docs: Blend function to use. If None, no blending is done.

defs.name: color_mask
defs.docs:
Color mask to use. Each flag indicates that the given color channel can be written to, and
 they can be OR'd together.

defs.name: Add
defs.docs: When combining two fragments, add their values together, saturating at 1.0

defs.name: Multiply
defs.docs: When combining two fragments, multiply their values together.

defs.name: Alpha
defs.docs:
When combining two fragments, add the value of the source times its alpha channel with the
 value of the destination multiplied by the inverse of the source alpha channel. Has the
 usual transparency effect: mixes the two colors using a fraction of each one specified by
 the alpha of the source.

defs.name: Invert
defs.docs:
When combining two fragments, subtract the destination color from a constant color
 using the source color as weight. Has an invert effect with the constant color
 as base and source color controlling displacement from the base color.
 A white source color and a white value results in plain invert.
 The output alpha is same as destination alpha.

defs.name: BlendPreset
defs.docs: Blend function presets for ease of use.

defs.name: new
defs.docs:
Create a default `DrawState`. Uses counter-clockwise winding, culls the backface of each
 primitive, and does no scissor/stencil/depth/blend/color masking.

defs.name: get_target_mask
defs.docs: Return a target mask that contains all the planes required by this state.

defs.name: multi_sample
defs.docs: Enable multi-sampled rasterization

defs.name: stencil
defs.value: fn (mut self, fun: state::Comparison, value: Stencil) -> DrawState
defs.docs: Set the stencil test to a simple expression

defs.name: depth
defs.value: fn (mut self, fun: state::Comparison, write: bool) -> DrawState
defs.docs: Set the depth test with the mask

defs.name: scissor
defs.value: fn (mut self, x: u16, y: u16, w: u16, h: u16) -> DrawState
defs.docs: Set the scissor

defs.name: blend
defs.docs: Set the blend mode to one of the presets
